title.narrative: BRS activities in relation to the ebola crisis in Sierra Leone, 2014

description.narrative: As an amendment to the existing International Humanitarian Partnership (IHP) support project to The World Health Organization (WHO) in Freetown, led by Danish Emergency Management Agency (DEMA), we have established a project to support the Ebola training for health professionals and other stakeholders in Sierra Leone. The existing IHP support project to WHO in Freetown, is a joint Danish Emergency Management Agency (DEMA) and Department for International Development (DFID) project. The aim of the Ebola training support project is to support the main training stakeholders in Sierra Leone with facilitation and organization of Ebola training with the following components: a) establishment and operation of training facilities, b) logistics and transport, c) administration, d) catering, e) supply to site of training materials, f) production of training manuals, g) others.
